intro: Anarrhinum demnatense, commonly known as the Demnat's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their toxic sap. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Anarrhinum demnatense is noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
